event: Earliest civilizations in Peru such as Norte Chico develop
Rise of Inca Empire under Pachacuti
Spanish conquistadors led by Francisco Pizarro capture Atahualpa
Lima founded by Pizarro as capital of the Spanish colony
Viceroyalty of Peru established by the Spanish crown
Túpac Amaru II leads Indigenous uprising against Spanish rule
General José de San Martín proclaims Peruvian independence
Battle of Ayacucho secures independence from Spain
Peru enters War of the Pacific against Chile
Peru defeated; loses territory to Chile
Military coup led by General Manuel Odría
Left-wing military government nationalizes key industries
Return to democracy; Shining Path insurgency begins
Alberto Fujimori elected president amid economic crisis
Fujimori dissolves Congress and assumes authoritarian powers
Fujimori resigns and flees to Japan after corruption scandals
Democratic elections restore constitutional rule
Pedro Pablo Kuczynski elected; later resigns amid scandal
Pedro Castillo elected president amid deep polarization
Castillo impeached and arrested; Dina Boluarte becomes president
